A0.description: Spanish alphabet, letter names, and core pronunciation patterns including vowels and consonants.

A0.name: Signos gráficos: tildes y ñ
A0.description: Introduction to written accents, dieresis, the letter ñ, and basic spelling conventions.

A0.name: Saludos y despedidas básicas
A0.description: Very simple greetings, goodbyes, and polite words like please and thank you.

A0.name: Presentarse: nombre y país
A0.description: Saying your name, country of origin, and very simple personal details.

A0.name: Números 0–20
A0.description: Basic numbers for age, quantity, and simple counting.

A0.name: Colores básicos
A0.description: Core color words and simple phrases using colors.

A0.name: Objetos de clase
A0.description: Common classroom items and simple there is/there are patterns.

A0.name: Frases de aula muy básicas
A0.description: Essential classroom instructions and questions like repeat, listen, open the book.

A0.name: Pronunciación de vocales y diptongos
A0.description: Short overview of Spanish vowels and common diphthongs for beginners.

A0.name: Formas básicas de cortesía
A0.description: Words and mini-expressions for politeness such as gracias, por favor, perdón.

A0.name: Personas: profesor, estudiante, amigo
A0.description: Core words for people and roles relevant to the classroom and daily life.

A0.name: Objetos personales muy básicos
A0.description: Simple nouns for phone, bag, keys and similar everyday objects.

A0.name: Sí, no y preguntas con tono
A0.description: Using yes, no, and rising intonation to form very basic questions.

A0.name: Palabras internacionales y préstamos
A0.description: Recognizing easy international words and common loanwords in Spanish.

A0.name: Primer contacto con artículos el/la
A0.description: Exposure to the most frequent definite articles el and la in fixed chunks.

A1.name: El alfabeto y acentuación básica
A1.description: Reinforcing alphabet, stress patterns, and basic rules for written accents.

A1.name: Saludos y presentaciones
A1.description: Introducing yourself and others, exchanging simple personal information.

A1.description: Talking about age, nationality, job, and contact details.

A1.description: Core family vocabulary and simple descriptions of people.

A1.name: Artículos y género
A1.description: Definite and indefinite articles, gender and number agreement of nouns.

A1.name: Pronombres personales sujeto
A1.description: Using subject pronouns yo, tú, él, ella, etc. in simple sentences.

A1.description: Conjugation and use of regular -ar, -er, -ir verbs in the present tense.

A1.name: Verbos frecuentes: ser, estar, tener, haber
A1.description: Basic contrasts and uses of ser, estar, tener, and hay in simple contexts.

A1.name: Verbos irregulares comunes en presente
A1.description: Key irregular verbs like ir, hacer, poder, querer in present tense.

A1.name: La casa y los objetos domésticos
A1.description: Rooms, furniture, and basic household objects.

A1.name: Comida y bebidas básicas
A1.description: Essential food vocabulary, meals, and ordering in a café.

A1.name: Rutinas diarias y frecuencia
A1.description: Talking about everyday activities with adverbs of frequency.

A1.name: Lugares de la ciudad y direcciones
A1.description: Basic places in town and asking for and giving simple directions.

A1.name: Adjetivos básicos y ser/estar para descripción
A1.description: Common adjectives and simple use of ser and estar for people and things.

A1.name: Hay y estar para ubicación
A1.description: Differentiating hay and está/están in location and existence sentences.

A1.name: Pronombres demostrativos y posesivos básicos
A1.description: Using este, ese, aquel and mi, tu, su, etc. in simple phrases.

A1.name: Interrogativos y preguntas simples
A1.description: Forming simple questions with qué, dónde, cuándo, cómo, por qué.

A1.name: Verbos reflexivos básicos
A1.description: Everyday reflexive verbs like levantarse, llamarse in present tense.

A1.name: Ortografía básica: mayúsculas, signos ¿¡

A2.name: Repaso de presente y verbos frecuentes
A2.description: Consolidating present tense regular and irregular verbs in longer sentences.

A2.description: Conjugation of regular and common irregular verbs in simple past.

A2.description: Talking about future plans using ir a + infinitive.

A2.description: Introduction to lo, la, le, les and their position with verbs.

A2.name: Comparativos y superlativos básicos
A2.description: Forming simple comparisons and superlatives with adjectives and adverbs.

A2.name: Vida cotidiana y tiempo libre
A2.description: Vocabulary and phrases for hobbies, leisure, and habits.

A2.name: Viajes: transporte y alojamiento
A2.description: Core phrases for tickets, hotels, and simple travel problems.

A2.description: Physical description and basic personality adjectives with ser and estar.

A2.name: Salud y partes del cuerpo
A2.description: Vocabulary for body, simple aches, and visiting the doctor.

A2.name: Cartas y correos electrónicos sencillos
A2.description: Basic formulas for informal messages and simple complaints.

A2.description: Talking about weather, seasons, and very simple environmental topics.

A2.description: Using simple connectors to join phrases and give reasons.

A2.description: Practical practice with accent marks on high-frequency words.

A2.name: Registros básicos: tú vs usted
A2.description: Choosing between tú and usted and simple formal vs informal phrases.

A2.name: Diferencias léxicas España / Latinoamérica I
A2.description: Very common vocabulary differences between Spain and Latin America.

B1.name: Repaso y contraste de tiempos pasados

B1.name: Pretérito imperfecto
B1.description: Forms and uses of imperfecto to describe habits and background.

B1.description: Future simple forms and use for predictions and assumptions.

B1.name: Condicional simple
B1.description: Using the conditional to express wishes, advice, and hypothetical situations.

B1.description: Relative clauses with que and donde to connect ideas.

B1.name: Narrar experiencias y anécdotas
B1.description: Telling personal stories coherently using past tenses and connectors.

B1.name: Opiniones, acuerdos y desacuerdos
B1.description: Functional language for giving opinions and reacting to others.

B1.description: Structure and key phrases for simple formal emails and letters.

B1.name: Conectores discursivos intermedios
B1.description: Connectors like sin embargo, además, por eso to organize speech.

B1.description: More subtle contrasts of ser and estar in typical B1 contexts.

B1.name: Español de España vs Latinoamérica I
B1.description: Common vocabulary and pronunciation differences at intermediate level.

B1.name: Medios de comunicación y actualidad

B1.name: Describir planes y proyectos
B1.description: Talking about medium-term plans with future and conditional.

B1.description: Common accent distinctions such as el / él, tu / tú, mas / más.

B2.description: Contrast between ser + participio and se + verbo for passive meanings.

B2.description: Advanced connectors such as no obstante, por consiguiente, aun así.

B2.description: Adjusting vocabulary and structures to different levels of formality.

B2.description: Organizing and delivering clear oral presentations on familiar topics.

A0.name: Alfabeto e sons básicos

A0.description: Numbers for age and basic counting.

A0.description: Common classroom nouns and simple phrases.

A0.name: Frases simples na aula
A0.description: Basic instructions and questions in the classroom.

A0.name: Palavras internacionais fáceis

A0.name: Sim, não e entonação interrogativa

A0.name: Primeiro contato com artigos o/a
A0.description: Exposure to o and a in frequent phrases.

A0.name: Objetos pessoais essenciais
A0.description: Words for phone, bag, keys, and similar items.

A0.description: Key words for people and very common jobs.

A0.name: Pronúncia de vogais nasais

A1.name: Artigos definidos e indefinidos
A1.description: Forms and use of o, a, os, as, um, uma, uns, umas.

A1.name: Gênero e número dos substantivos
A1.description: Regular patterns of masculine/feminine and plural formation.

A1.name: Pronomes pessoais sujeito
A1.description: Eu, tu, você, ele, ela, nós, vocês, eles, elas in simple sentences.

A1.name: Verbo ser e estar no presente
A1.description: Basic forms and uses of ser and estar at A1 level.

A1.description: Conjugation of regular -ar, -er, -ir verbs in the present.

A1.name: Verbos frequentes: ter, ir, fazer, poder
A1.description: High-frequency irregular verbs in present tense.

A1.name: Família e relações
A1.description: Family vocabulary and simple descriptions with ser.

A1.description: Rooms, furniture, and basic prepositions of place.

A1.name: Comidas, bebidas e no restaurante
A1.description: Basic food items and ordering in a café or restaurant.

A1.name: Dias, meses, datas e horas
A1.description: Calendar vocabulary and telling the time.

A1.name: Rotina diária
A1.description: Talking about daily activities with frequency adverbs.

A1.name: Adjetivos básicos e concordância
A1.description: Common adjectives and agreement with nouns.

A1.name: Preposições simples de lugar e tempo
A1.description: Use of em, a, de, para, com, por in simple contexts.

A1.name: Perguntas simples
A1.description: Yes/no questions and interrogative words like onde, quando, como.

A1.description: Introduction to stress patterns and common accents.

A1.name: Vocabulário da cidade e direções
A1.description: Places in town and asking/giving simple directions.

A1.name: Lazer e hobbies
A1.description: Talking about free-time activities and preferences.

A1.description: Very common lexical and pronunciation differences between Brazilian and European Portuguese.

A1.name: Mensagens curtas e e-mails simples
A1.description: Writing short informal messages and basic emails.

A1.name: Expressões de cortesia e tratamento
A1.description: Use of você, tu and polite expressions in A1 contexts.

A2.name: Pretérito perfeito simples
A2.description: Forms and basic uses of simple past to talk about completed actions.

A2.name: Imperfeito: introdução
A2.description: Imperfect tense to describe background and repeated past actions.

A2.description: Basic contrast between completed events and background descriptions.

A2.name: Futuro próximo com ir + infinitivo
A2.description: Talking about plans using ir + infinitive.

A2.description: Basic use and position of direct and indirect object pronouns.

A2.name: Comparativos e superlativos
A2.description: Forming comparisons and superlatives with adjectives and adverbs.

A2.description: Refining vocabulary for time, duration, and frequency.

A2.description: Language for shopping, prices, and service encounters.

A2.description: Phrases for tickets, reservations, and travel problems.

A2.name: Saúde, corpo e no médico

A2.description: Richer descriptions of routines, hobbies, and habits.

A2.description: Using simple conjunctions to join clauses and explain reasons.

A2.name: Cartas e e-mails simples formais
A2.description: Basic formats and formulas for formal written communication.

A2.name: Clima e ambiente básico
A2.description: Talking about weather, seasons, and simple environmental topics.

A2.name: Ortografia: acentos em palavras frequentes
A2.description: Practising accents and nasal vowels in frequent words.

A2.description: More lexical and some grammatical contrasts between Brazilian and European Portuguese.

A2.name: Narrar experiências recentes
A2.description: Using past tenses and connectors to tell short stories.

A2.name: Descrever pessoas e personalidade
A2.description: Physical and character descriptions with richer adjectives.

A2.name: Planos e intenções futuras
A2.description: Talking about future projects using near future and modals.

A2.name: Contraste entre perfeito e imperfeito II
A2.description: Further practice with narratives combining both tenses.

B1.name: Revisão de tempos verbais principais
B1.description: Consolidating key indicative past, present, and future tenses.

B1.name: Futuro simples e probabilidade
B1.description: Using simple future for predictions and assumptions.

B1.name: Vocabulário de trabalho e estudo
B1.description: Lexis for employment, education, and training contexts.

B1.name: Narrar experiências e histórias
B1.description: Longer narratives combining different past tenses.

B1.description: Language for opinions, agreement, and disagreement.

B1.description: Writing structured emails and simple complaint letters.

B1.description: Vocabulary and structures from news and media texts.

B1.name: Diferenças PT-BR e PT-PT III
B1.description: Wider lexical, phonological, and pragmatic differences.

B1.description: Spelling reforms, hyphenation, and common difficulties.

B1.name: Textos narrativos e descritivos
B1.description: Reading and writing longer descriptions and stories.

B1.name: Vocabulário abstrato e emocional
B1.description: Words for emotions, attitudes, and abstract ideas.

B1.name: Estratégias de conversa fluida
B1.description: Hesitation devices, reformulation, and clarification.

B1.name: Expressões idiomáticas básicas
B1.description: Common idioms appropriate for B1 learners.

B1.name: Planejamento de projetos e objetivos
B1.description: Talking in detail about future plans and ambitions.

B2.description: Real and hypothetical conditions in present and past.

B2.description: Less common spelling and accentuation issues.

B2.name: Apresentações orais estruturadas

C1.name: Domínio avançado de tempos e modos

C1.description: Advanced lexis in selected professional or academic fields.

C1.description: Subtle phonological, lexical, and grammatical differences.

C2.description: Fine-tuning fluency and accuracy to near-native levels.

C2.name: Nuances semânticas e registro
C2.description: Very precise management of meaning and register choices.

C2.name: Idiomatismo avançado
C2.description: Extensive command of idioms, slang, and figurative language.
